sections.content: Origami content is meditative and precise—each fold transforms simple paper into art. Viewers need to see folds clearly, understand orientation, and follow along. Overhead cameras, good lighting, and clear demonstrations are essential. Here's what successful origami YouTubers use.

sections.title: Origami Content Tips
content: ASMR of paper folding is popular

faq.question: Best overhead setup for origami?
faq.answer: Copy stand most stable. C-stand with boom arm works well. Elgato arm for desk setup. Position camera directly overhead looking down. No angle—pure overhead for fold clarity.

faq.question: What paper shows best on camera?
faq.answer: Medium-weight paper with good contrast to background. Avoid very white paper under bright lights—can blow out. Colored paper often films better. Kami (origami paper) standard choice.

faq.question: Should I use ASMR sounds?
faq.answer: Paper folding sounds are naturally satisfying. Many viewers enjoy pure paper sounds without music. Consider separate ASMR versions. Good microphone placement captures folds beautifully.

faq.question: How to show both hands and folds?
faq.answer: Overhead camera shows hands naturally. Keep movements in frame. Practice fold sequence to avoid going out of frame. Some creators use face cam for complex explanations.
